linkedinHeadline: Day Manager / Digital Marketing Manager at Brilliant Corners Artist Management
linkedinDescription: The first concert I ever went to was My Chemical Romance supporting Blink-182 at The Hollywood Bowl ‚Äì I've been hooked on a life of music since. In high school, I started an online music publication called Omnisound Magazine that I ran throughout my college years at UC Berkeley. While pursuing music journalism as a hobby, I thought I wanted to major in chemical engineering which I studied for a year before I decided my passion was elsewhere. Sitting in the lobby at the Fox Theater in Oakland writing lab reports on deadline between photographing sets was not for me!I took an interest in music marketing and knew that was where I wanted to land post-graduation. I was fortunate to stay in the Bay Area and joined Brilliant Corners Artist Management in 2018 where I am currently the Digital Marketing Manager working on strategy across our roster (Death Cab for Cutie, Toro y Moi, Soccer Mommy and more) in addition to being a Day Manager. I am dedicated to both artist development as well as creating a lasting legacy for acts that have been around for 25+ years.Being surrounded by music nerds on all sides of the business energizes me. I enjoy hearing new perspectives in the ever-evolving landscape of our field. At the end of the day, I love helping artists achieve their career goals and authentically connect with their fans through a digital-forward mindset. Big picture success starts with your boots on the ground ‚Äì all these years later Blink-182's lyrics still ring in my head, it's "all the small things." Feel free to contact me at nicolewhitecreative@gmail.com üë©üíª

linkedinSchoolDescription: I graduated from UC Berkeley in May 2018 with a Bachelor of Arts degree in Interdisciplinary Studies Field ‚Äì a self-directed major.
